thread.title_full: Jolly LLB 2 box-office collection Day 10: Akshay Kumar's film makes hay on Saturday : Bollywood, News - India Today

title: Jolly LLB 2 box-office collection Day 10: Akshay Kumar's film makes hay on Saturday : Bollywood, News - India Today
text:
Thank heavens for the weekend. After a gradual slowing down of box-office numbers throughout last week, Akshay Kumar has much reason to smile now. 
His film Jolly LLB 2 got massive footfalls on Saturday and thus, the box-office graph saw a sudden rise. Rs 100 crore doesn't seem so far now if this pace can be maintained throughout week 2. 
MOVIE REVIEW: JOLLY LLB 2 
Competing against Jolly LLB 2 are multiple Bollywood and Hollywood releases that hit the screens this week. 
Most prominent among them are The Ghazi Attack which is expected to do well thanks to positive word of mouth. On the Hollywood front, there is the action thriller John Wick 2 and the animated film The Lego Batman Movie. 
Nevertheless, Akki has already crossed the Rs 85-crore mark. It is only a matter of time till Jolly LLB 2 is declared a super-hit. 
Here is the complete day by day box-office collection of Jolly LLB 2: 
WEEK 1 
Day 1 (10th Feb, Friday) - Rs 13.20 crore 
Day 2 (11th Feb, Saturday) - Rs 17.31 crore 
Day 3 (12th Feb, Sunday) - Rs 19.95 crore 
Day 4 (13th Feb, Monday) - Rs 7.26 crore 
Day 5 (14th Feb, Tuesday) - Rs 9.07 crore 
Day 6 (15th Feb, Wednesday) - Rs 5.89 crore 
Day 7 (16th Feb, Thursday) - Rs 5.03 crore 
WEEK 2 
Day 8 (17th Feb, Friday) - Rs 4.14 crore 
Day 9 (18th Feb, Saturday) - Rs 5.02 crore 
Total box-office collection of Jolly LLB 2 after TEN days: Rs 86.87 crore 
Jolly LLB 2 is the first of many films starring Akshay Kumar this year. Akshay will be next seen in a cameo role in Taapsee Pannu-starrer Naam Shabana, the prequel to Baby. Followed by this, Akshay will be seen in the Hindi film Toilet: Ek Prem Katha and 2.0, the sequel to Enthiran, that will unite Rajinikanth with Akshay as hero and villain, respectively. 
2016 was a highly successful year for Akshay Kumar as all his three films that released last year, Airlift, Housefull 3 and Rustom, earned over Rs 100 crore at the box office. Will Akshay be able to replicate that success this year? Only time will tell.
